intro: Bursinopetalum tetrandrum, commonly known as the four-threaded bursera, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Bursinopetalum tetrandrum is adapted to survive in dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
